meanings.definition: A person who lives near or next to another.
meanings.sent1: My neighbors always wave hello when I see them outside.
meanings.sent2: Our neighbors hosted a barbecue last weekend.
meanings.sent3: The neighbors' cat likes to visit our backyard and play with our dog.
meanings.sent4: In our small town, everyone knows their neighbors like family.
meanings.sent5: The neighbors' children often play together in the park.

meanings.definition: To be situated next to or near something.
meanings.sent1: Our house neighbors the park, so we can hear children playing all day.
meanings.sent2: The grocery store neighbors the post office in our town.
meanings.sent3: The bakery neighbors the flower shop, creating a lovely aroma on the street.
meanings.sent4: The mountains majestically neighbor the peaceful valley below.
meanings.sent5: The river neighbors the forest, providing a serene view for hikers.

meanings.definition: To be friendly or kind to someone in need.
meanings.sent1: Our community always neighbors those who are going through tough times.
meanings.sent2: During the storm, our neighbors offered us shelter in their home.
meanings.sent3: The kind old lady neighbors everyone in the neighborhood, always offering a smile.
meanings.sent4: In times of crisis, it's heartwarming to see how people come together to neighbor each other.
meanings.sent5: The small town spirit shines through as everyone neighbors one another during the holidays.
